main event: An unidentified flying object was sighted by the USS Davis on August 25, 1960, over the Western Mediterranean.
interesting points: The object was described as being blue-green and moving erratically in a southerly direction,The sighting lasted for about 3 minutes and was reported through military channels,The object was observed to blink, leading some to consider it a possible balloon or aircraft,There were two separate sightings by the USS Davis that provided continuous observations of the object,Limited information from the investigation made it difficult to conclude definitively about the object's nature.
location: Western Mediterranean, Mediterranean Sea, International Waters
witness description: crew members of the USS Davis
